detaileddescription.para: Define I2S control commands for common usage
Define I2S control commands for master usage

Get current device status
Param type : uint32_t *
Param usage : store result of current status
Return value explanation :

Set I2S transmit success callback function when all required bytes are transmitted for interrupt method
Param type : DEV_CALLBACK * or NULL
Param usage : transmit success callback function for I2S
Return value explanation :

Set I2S receive success callback function when all required bytes are received for interrupt method
Param type : DEV_CALLBACK * or NULL
Param usage : receive success callback function for I2S
Return value explanation :

Set I2S transfer error callback function when something error happened for interrupt method
Param type : DEV_CALLBACK * or NULL
Param usage : transfer error callback function for I2S
Return value explanation :

Enable or disable transmit interrupt
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : enable(none-zero) or disable(zero) flag
Return value explanation :

Enable or disable receive interrupt
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : enable(none-zero) or disable(zero) flag
Return value explanation :

Do a software reset for I2S device, it will stop current transfer, and clear error state and bring device to normal state, set next condition to STOP
Param type : NULL
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

Flush I2S device transmit buffer or fifo
Param type : NULL
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

Flush I2S device receive buffer or fifo
Param type : NULL
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

Enable I2S device
Param type : Device channel nummber
Param usage : Specified device channel number
Return value explanation :

Disable I2S device, when device is disabled, only I2S_CMD_ENA_DEV, I2S_CMD_DIS_DEV, I2S_CMD_GET_STATUS and I2S_CMD_RESET commands can be executed, other commands will return E_SYS
Param type : Device channel nummber
Param usage : Specified device channel number
Return value explanation :

Set buffer for interrupt transmit, and it will set tx_buf.
I2S transmitter command If setting TX buffer to NULL, when tx interrupt is enabled and entered into tx interrupt, it will automatically disable the tx interrupt, so when you want to transfer something, you need to set the tx buffer to Non-NULL and enable tx interrupt, when the tx buffer is sent, it will disable the tx interrupt and call tx callback function if available.
Param type : DEV_BUFFER * or NULL
Param usage : buffer structure pointer, if param is NULL, then it will set tx_buf to NULL
Return value explanation :

Set buffer for interrupt receive, and it will set rx_buf
I2S receiver command Similiar to I2S_CMD_SET_TXINT_BUF
Param type : DEV_BUFFER * or NULL
Param usage : buffer structure pointer, if param is NULL, then it will set rx_buf to NULL
Return value explanation :

Set buffer empty threshold in the TX FIFO, these bit program the empty trigger level in the TX FIFO
I2S transmitter command These command is used to set trigger level in the TX FIFO at which empty threshold reached flag/interrupt is generated.
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : Specified trigger level value (16b) + channel (16b)
Return value explanation :

Set buffer available data threshold in the TX FIFO, these bit program the trigger level in the RX FIFO
I2S receiver command These command is used to set trigger level in the RX FIFO at which received data available flag/interrupt is generated.
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : Specified trigger level value (16b) + channel (16b)
Return value explanation :

Enable or disable clock for master
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : enable(none-zero) or disable(zero) flag
Return value explanation :

Program the number of sclk cycles for word select line stays
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : clock cycles
Return value explanation :

Program the number of gating of sclk cycles for word select line stays
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : gating of sclk cycles
Return value explanation :
Set extra information pointer of I2S
Get extra information pointer of I2S
N/A data resolution
12 bits audio data resolution
16 bits audio data resolution
20 bits audio data resolution
24 bits audio data resolution
32 bits audio data resolution
N/A audio sample rate
16KHz audio sample rate
32KHz audio sample rate
44.1KHz audio sample rate
48KHz audio sample rate
96KHz audio sample rate
192KHz audio sample rate
I2S TX device
I2S RX device
Currently in I2S device free state
Currently in I2S master transmit state
Currently in I2S master receive state
Currently in I2S device free state
RX FIFO data overrun
TX FIFO data overrun
Undefined error cases
informations about I2S open state, working state, baurate, I2S registers, working method, interrupt number

define I2S device interface, like I2S information structure, fuctions to get I2S info, open/close/control I2S, send/receive data by I2S
all this details are implemented by user in user porting code

briefdescription.para: get an i2s device by i2s device id. For how to use i2s device hal refer to Functions in i2s device structure

detaileddescription.para:
i2s_id
id of i2s, defined by user
!NULL
pointer to an i2s device structure
NULL
failed to find the i2s device by i2s_id
need to implemented by user in user code
get one designware device structure
Provide common definitions for I2S device, then software developer can develop I2S driver following this definitions, and the applications can directly call this definition to realize functions
